item.title: Notes on The Elements of Statistical Learning
item.description: Purpose The Elements of Statistical Learning is the best resource I’ve found for understanding modern statistical and machine learning techniques. These techniques aim to answer problems of the following kind: what’s the best approximation to the conditional expectation function \(f(x) = E[Y|X]\)? Or more generally, what is our best guess for \(Y\) given what we know about \(X\)? Where ‘best’ can be defined in a number of ways, but usually results in trying to appoximate the conditional expectation function.
